meanings.definition: Of the same kind or nature
meanings.sent1: The team had a homogeneous approach to problem-solving.
meanings.sent2: The cake batter was perfectly homogeneous after mixing.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see a homogeneous group of penguins waddling together.
meanings.sent4: The sky looked like a homogeneous blanket of stars on a clear night.
meanings.sent5: The artist aimed to create a painting with a homogeneous color palette.

meanings.definition: Consisting of parts all of the same kind
meanings.sent1: The forest was a homogeneous mix of tall pine trees.
meanings.sent2: The soup was so well stirred that it appeared homogeneous.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to watch a homogeneous row of ducks following each other.
meanings.sent4: The field of wheat looked like a homogeneous golden carpet.
meanings.sent5: The classroom had a homogeneous group of students all wearing blue uniforms.
